title: Lighting System Energy Efficiency Guidelines
overview: Lighting typically accounts for 15-25% of building energy consumption. Modern LED technology and smart controls can significantly reduce this.

measures: Replace incandescent and fluorescent lighting with LED
LED efficiency: 80-100 lumens per watt vs. 10-20 for incandescent
Install occupancy sensors in offices, classrooms, and common areas
Use dimming controls to reduce light levels when appropriate
Schedule lighting based on occupancy patterns
Optimize lighting layouts to reduce over-lighting
Implement lighting zones for better control

high: Replace high-use area lighting with LED
Install occupancy sensors in frequently unoccupied spaces
